title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose above $2,850 per tonne, recovering from a near one-month low of $2,790 on November 18. The rebound was supported by macroeconomic tailwinds, including favorable monetary policies and fresh stimulus signals from Beijing to combat its property crisis.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The U.S. aluminum premium reached a record high, with spot market buyers paying $4,792 per ton while the base aluminum price was $2,850. The high premiums are driven by tariffs and a global supply squeeze, compounded by supply shortages linked to energy transition and AI demand, while macroeconomic factors support prices.

title: Year-end consumption weakened coupled with high aluminum price suppression, the operating rate of aluminum processors came under pressure and pulled back to 61.9%: Aluminum Processing Weekly Survey
summary: The operating rate of leading domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell to 61.9% due to high aluminum prices suppressing spot order transactions and cautious demand. Structural divergence persists with declines in construction and packaging sectors, and no significant improvement in demand is expected before the Chinese New Year.

title: SMM weekly survey: Aluminium processing industry strained by off-season and high aluminium prices, with structural divergence persisting
summary: High aluminum prices above RMB 22,000 per tonne and off-season effects have dampened downstream enthusiasm and suppressed operations in the aluminum processing industry. Structural order differences remain significant, with declines in construction and packaging sectors, and weak year-end stockpiling expected to continue into December.

title: Rusal Cuts Aluminum Production by Over 6% to Combat Rising Alumina Prices and Macroeconomic Risks
summary: Rusal announced a reduction of over 6% in aluminum production to address the surge in alumina prices and macroeconomic risks. This move reflects the company's response to cost pressures and uncertain market conditions.

title: SMM Weekly Survey: Aluminum Processing Industry Strained by Off-Season and High Aluminum Prices with Structural Divergence Persisting
summary: The aluminum processing industry is experiencing strain due to the off-season and high aluminum prices, with operating rates declining. Primary aluminum alloy production remains stable, but cautious demand and structural differences in orders persist, with no short-term improvement expected.

title: Aluminum Futures Rise Amid Supply Constraints and Production Challenges
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,909.20 per ton due to supply decreases from production cuts in China and disruptions such as equipment failure at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter. China’s output cap and setbacks in new smelter projects in Indonesia contribute to tightening market conditions.

title: Constellium's Incoming CEO Discusses Scrap Bans, National Security, and Growth Plans
summary: Constellium's CEO highlights the industry's fragmentation and the importance of recycling and scrap retention in Europe amid lost primary capacity and sanctions on Russian metal imports. The company sees growth opportunities in automotive, aerospace, and sustainable packaging sectors, emphasizing national security concerns.

title: EU Risks Slow Demise of Aluminum Industry if Carbon Tax Not Scrapped, Constellium CEO Says
summary: The upcoming EU carbon tax (CBAM) is expected to increase costs for aluminum producers and push European premiums to a 10-month high. The tax could lead to gradual capacity shutdowns and investment shifts outside Europe, threatening the region's aluminum industry sustainability.

title: ALUPCO pioneers sustainable aluminium for the energy transition era
summary: ALUPCO is advancing sustainable aluminium production through technological upgrades like automation and Industry 4.0 tools, strategic partnerships, and recycling programs producing 'green billets'. The company focuses on energy-efficient processes, ISO 14001 certification, and products meeting LEED standards, supporting green building credits and renewable energy integration.

title: Aluminum's Impact on Sustainable Development Goals
summary: Aluminum drives sustainable development by enabling circular manufacturing through recycling innovation and energy efficiency. The material supports economic growth, especially in electric vehicles and construction, with technology priorities on recycling efficiency and AI applications for sorting. Market growth is projected through 2030, with sustainable aluminum commanding price premiums and investment in recycling infrastructure and renewable energy integration.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminium produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining higher recycled content with low-carbon primary aluminium. The ELYSIS process eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions by using inert anode technology, producing oxygen instead of CO2, marking a significant innovation in aluminium packaging sustainability.

title: Aluminum Recycling Market to Reach US$91.3 Billion by 2032 as Global Demand for Low-Carbon Metals & Circular Manufacturing Surges
summary: The aluminium recycling industry is expanding rapidly due to technological innovation and policy acceleration, with recycling requiring 95% less energy than primary production. Advances include hydrogen-powered remelting furnaces and AI-guided scrap sorting, increasing efficiency and reducing emissions. The market growth is driven by demand in electric vehicles and circular manufacturing, with OEM mandates for high recycled content in aluminium products.

title: Aluminum stabilizes high-nickel cathodes, curbing rapid capacity loss in EV batteries
summary: Research shows that substituting a small amount of nickel with aluminum in high-nickel cathodes stabilizes the battery structure by reducing oxygen hole formation, significantly enhancing EV battery lifespan and safety. This innovation addresses capacity degradation and thermal runaway risks, offering a key strategy for next-generation high-performance batteries.

title: World's first high-power aluminum-ion battery system for energy storage
summary: A new high-power aluminum-ion battery system has been developed focusing on sustainable, lithium-free cell chemistry, wireless battery management, and recyclability. The INNOBATT demonstrator integrates advanced pouch cells with a novel diamond-based quantum sensor for precise current measurement, proving stability and innovation in aluminum battery technology.

title: Steel Prices Hold Steady Ahead of 2025
summary: Steel prices have fallen 2.4% from the end of Q3 2025, with the Raw Steels Monthly Metals Index showing a modest 1.78% decline from November to December. Buyers noted flexible pricing from mills, and a seasonal pickup in demand is expected in Q1 2026. Chinese steel slab prices and LME steel scrap prices fell, while Comex HRC futures rose 4.64% as of early December.

title: Steel Price Trends and Market Update
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose above CNY 3,100 per tonne in early December, reaching a three-month high amid lower supply and government support measures to address the property market crisis. Despite a 0.93% price drop on December 5, steel prices have risen 2.24% over the past month but remain 5.13% lower than a year ago. Crude steel output in China fell 12% annually in October 2025.

title: HRC Steel Price Update and Forecast
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel prices fell slightly to 903.04 USD/T on December 5, 2025, down 0.33% from the previous day. Over the past month, HRC prices have risen 6.62%, and are up 31.49% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect HRC Steel to trade at around 911.59 USD/T by the end of Q1 2026 and 992.41 USD/T in 12 months.

title: US Steel to resume production at Illinois plant shut 3 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will restart steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, which had its last blast furnace shut down in 2023. The decision follows increased customer demand and pressure from the White House, with plans to resume production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers. Domestic steel shipments have increased, supported by tariffs and a rebound in automaking and construction.

title: US Steel to resume steel production at Illinois plant shut 2 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel will restart steel making at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois by reopening the blast furnace idled two years ago amid strikes. The company cited strong customer demand and expects to resume production in early 2026 after hiring 400 workers. The U.S. steel market is bolstered by tariffs and growth in automaking and construction, with plans to invest $14 billion in U.S. steel production.

title: Advanced steelmaking technologies could substantially reduce carbon emissions
summary: A new study by MIT, University of Illinois, and ExxonMobil shows that combining carbon capture, low-carbon fuels, and increased recycling can deeply decarbonize steelmaking by 2050. The study highlights the potential of replacing coal-based processes with electric arc furnaces fueled by natural gas with carbon capture or hydrogen, achieving over 50% emission reductions if technology costs are manageable.

title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
summary: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations have reduced emissions by nearly 10% at Spartan UK's steel plant in Newcastle. The company is advancing its AI-based optimization system to support energy efficiency and net zero goals in steel production, with backing from the UK government’s Manchester Prize initiative.

title: Steelmaking decarbonisation - BHP
summary: BHP emphasizes the critical role of steel in global energy transition and supports multiple technology pathways to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in steelmaking. Key enablers include cheaper renewable energy and carbon capture infrastructure, aiming for a 30% reduction in emissions intensity by post-2030 adoption.

title: World's First General Design Approval (GDA) for Developed Steel and Post-Weld Heat Treatment (PWHT) Exemption based on ECA for Low-pressure ...
summary: Nippon Steel, in collaboration with Mitsubishi Shipbuilding, has developed TMCP steel under the NSCarbolex™ Solution brand to enhance economic performance of CCUS value chains and contribute significantly to carbon neutrality goals by 2050.

title: Mitsui to Invest in EVERSTEEL – Developer and Supplier of AI-based Steel Scrap Analysis Systems
summary: Mitsui is investing in EVERSTEEL to advance AI-based steel scrap analysis, addressing challenges in scrap quality assessment and supply reliability. This collaboration supports decarbonization by promoting electric arc furnace steel production and enhancing competitiveness through digital transformation.

title: Addressing steel decarbonisation challenges for industry and policy
summary: The OECD highlights that over 90% of steelmaking capacity is in countries committed to net-zero targets, but decarbonization faces challenges such as scaling technologies, securing investments, and creating markets for low-carbon steel. Effective policies are needed to support innovation, infrastructure, and demand for sustainable steel.

title: Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025
summary: worldsteel’s Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025 in Singapore provided a platform for technical experts to network and explore technology options necessary to decarbonize the steel industry, with presentations available for download.

title: Copper Hits Fresh Record on Fears of Global Supply Squeeze
summary: Copper prices climbed to a fresh record driven by fears of a global supply shortage as traders stockpile in the U.S. and optimism around Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts. Futures on the London Metal Exchange rose 1.6% to $11,617 a metric ton after hitting an intraday high of $11,705, with prices up more than 32% so far this year.

title: Copper Price Surge on Global Supply Squeeze and Tariff Speculation: A Tailwind for Australian Miners
summary: Copper has surged more than 30% on the LME this year amid supply disruptions from major mine outages and speculation of U.S. tariffs on refined copper. Heavy shipments to the U.S. and widening price arbitrage between U.S. and global markets are driving stockpiling and pushing premiums higher in Europe and Asia, signaling a tightening market expected to intensify in early 2026.

title: Copper Hits All-Time Highs! Scrap Prices Surge Heading ...
summary: Copper futures have broken all-time price records, driven primarily by speculative buying and algorithm-driven trades rather than stronger demand. The rally surprised market professionals, with investor flows, thin London inventories, and uncertainty around U.S. trade policy cited as key factors.

title: Gold, Silver Hit New Weekend Records as Copper Market 'Fractures'
summary: Copper is caught in a tug of war between bullish and cautious outlooks despite prices above $11,000, with inventories elevated. Citigroup forecasts copper could reach a record $13,000 per ton by mid-2026 due to stronger growth expectations, tightening physical balances, and tariff-driven stockpiling, highlighted by a recent large withdrawal of copper from LME warehouses.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Copper futures in the U.S. climbed to around $5.4 per pound on December 5, 2025, the highest in over four months, amid ongoing supply disruptions and a large withdrawal of metal from LME warehouses. Copper prices have risen over 8% in the past month and nearly 30% compared to the previous year, driven by fears of U.S. levies on refined copper next year.

title: Copper Hits Fresh Record on Fears of Global Supply Squeeze
summary: Copper prices reached a new record high driven by concerns over a global supply shortage, with futures on the London Metal Exchange rising 1.6% to $11,617 per metric ton. The price surge is fueled by disrupted supply chains and strong demand for refined copper in the U.S., with prices up more than 32% this year.

title: Copper Quest Closes $1,927,000 Private Placement
summary: Copper Quest Exploration Inc. announced the closing of a $1.927 million private placement to support its North American critical mineral projects. The company focuses on copper exploration and development, highlighting copper's strategic importance amid rising global demand and supply challenges.

title: Chile to reach milestones in 13 copper projects worth US$14.8bn in 2026, amid a bull market
summary: Chile is set to achieve significant milestones in 13 copper projects valued at $14.8 billion in 2026, reflecting a strong bull market for copper. These projects encompass various mining activities including open pit mining, exploration, and underground mining, contributing to increased production capacity.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto successfully produced its first copper using Nuton technology at the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona. This marks a technological advancement in copper production, potentially improving efficiency and sustainability in mining operations.

title: Copper Reaches All-Time High Amid Weaker Dollar, Supply Concerns
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange briefly hit an all-time high of $11,434.50 per metric ton, rising 1.7% amid a weaker U.S. dollar and ongoing supply concerns. The market remains bullish despite some indicators of weakening industrial demand.

title: RIO Boosts Copper Innovation With First Copper Output Using Nuton Tech
summary: Rio Tinto produced the first copper using its Nuton Technology at the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona. Nuton combines biology, chemistry, engineering, and digital tools to enable cleaner, faster, and more efficient copper production with up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions compared to traditional methods. The technology shortens supply chains by producing copper cathode directly at the mine and can extend mine life by extracting value from previously uneconomic ores.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
summary: After over 30 years of R&D, Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology produced its first copper cathode at the Johnson Camp mine. Nuton achieves industrial-scale copper production in just 18 months from concept, compared to 18 years industry-wide, and uses microorganisms grown onsite. The technology reduces water use by up to 80% and carbon emissions by up to 60%, aiming to produce copper with the lowest carbon footprint in the U.S., supported by 100% renewable electricity.

title: How Nuton is redefining copper for a low-impact future
summary: Nuton, a Rio Tinto venture, is pioneering cleaner copper production through bioleach solutions that minimize environmental impact. Winner of the Technology & Innovation – Miner award at the Mining Magazine Awards 2025, Nuton scales breakthrough heap leaching technologies to unlock new copper resources while supporting a positive environmental impact and the energy transition.

title: Vale–Glencore Sudbury Venture Aims to Unlock 880,000-Ton Copper Volume for North America
summary: Vale and Glencore announced a joint venture to unlock 880,000 tons of copper in Sudbury, Canada, supporting North America's critical minerals strategy. The project aims to increase copper supply for clean energy technologies, electric vehicles, and power grids, reducing reliance on foreign supply chains. This initiative reflects a shift toward smarter, lower-impact mining to support economic growth and the global transition to a low-carbon future.

title: Chile, Peru, Brazil and Argentina Look to the Copper Boom with Optimism
summary: Latin American countries are optimistic about the copper boom driven by clean technologies and electric vehicles. The region is expected to attract significant investment focused on sustainable mining practices and ESG principles, aiming to reduce dependence on Asian refining capacity. Copper is seen as a strategic resource essential for solar panels, wind turbines, and electrical grids, with projected investments of US$246 billion by 2050.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Dropped Slightly on December 5
summary: Nickel prices on the SHFE slightly declined, with the most-traded contract closing at 117,700 yuan/mt, down 0.03%. Market expectations for a US Fed interest rate cut in December rose to about 89%, but nickel prices are expected to fluctuate in the short term due to recent inventory declines and economic data.

title: Nickel rose to 14,970 USD/T on December 5, 2025
summary: Nickel prices increased by 0.57% on December 5, reaching 14,970 USD per ton. Despite the recent rise, nickel prices have fallen about 0.56% over the past month and are down 6.51% compared to the same time last year.

title: Nickel declines as dollar rises on Fed rate outlook
summary: Nickel prices fell amid a stronger US dollar and uncertainty over Federal Reserve rate cuts. The bank forecasts nickel prices to decline by 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026, citing persistent oversupply and reduced rate cut expectations.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
summary: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association set benchmark prices for nickel ore for early December 2025, with prices decreasing by about 2.21% from late November. Prices for different nickel content grades were lowered, reflecting a slight market softening.

title: Nickel Prices Poised to Exit $15K Range as Seasonal Supply Constraints Hit Market
summary: Nickel prices have been range-bound between $15,000 and $15,800 per ton since April 2025, but seasonal supply drops in the Philippines and regulatory crackdowns in Indonesia are creating upward pressure. Growing electric vehicle demand and government support in Canada may further support price increases.

title: Nickel prices on Dec 6th rebound amid strong US job data
summary: LME nickel futures prices rebounded by $73/ton to close at $16,047/ton on December 6, supported by strong US employment data and declining LME inventories, indicating renewed market strength.

title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
summary: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for next year, targeting 170,000-200,000 tons, alongside a 3% rise in iron ore and copper production. The company aims to become the world's largest iron ore producer and plans capital investments of $5.4 to $5.7 billion for 2026.

title: Critical Minerals Gap Widens As U.S. Delays Key Decisions
summary: U.S. executives urge faster government action on critical minerals projects, including nickel, to compete with China's dominance. Westwin Elements' CEO calls for pressure on Indonesia to limit nickel production, which has surged to about 60% of global supply and caused nickel prices to drop nearly 50%.

title: Global Nickel Production Expected to be 3.65 Million Tons in 2025
source: International Nickel Study Group (INSG) via Yieh.com
summary: The International Nickel Study Group forecasts global nickel production to reach 3.65 million tons in 2025, up from 3.52 million tons previously. This reflects ongoing growth in nickel supply worldwide.

title: China Built Indonesia's Nickel Boom But Could Yet Bust It
summary: China's financing and construction transformed Indonesia into the world's largest nickel producer, but overproduction risks a prolonged global supply surplus. Indonesian nickel output, largely Chinese-owned, may continue expanding, potentially causing oversupply until at least 2030 despite government signals to slow growth.

title: US Minerals Projects Seek 'Industrial Vision' from Washington to Compete with China
summary: Westwin, building the only U.S. nickel refinery, urges the U.S. government to impose quotas on Indonesian nickel production to stabilize prices. Indonesian output has surged to about 60% of global supply, causing nickel prices to fall nearly 50%, challenging U.S. projects aiming to refine nickel domestically.

title: Tartisan Nickel Corp Closes $1.05M Flow-Through Private Placement
summary: Tartisan Nickel Corp closed a $1.05 million flow-through private placement to fund exploration and development of its Kenbridge Nickel-Copper-Cobalt Project in Northwestern Ontario. The financing supports advancing the company's nickel production capacity.

title: Ironic Metals to Decarbonize Iron and Nickel Production with Anglo American
summary: Ironic Metals is developing technology using renewable electricity for high-purity green iron and nickel production, aiming to double energy efficiency and reduce emissions. The process can use lower-grade ores and mine waste, targeting near-zero emissions in nickel production.

title: Renforth Collaborates with CTRI to assess sustainability opportunities at Victoria nickel polymetallic open pit deposit
summary: Renforth Resources has partnered with the Centre Technologique des Résidus Industriels (CTRI) to explore sustainability technologies at its Victoria nickel sulphide polymetallic open pit deposit in Quebec. The initiatives include investigating carbon sequestration by ultramafic rocks, biological heap leaching, and microbiome analysis to enhance metal production and environmental outcomes.

title: Aluminum stabilizes high-nickel cathodes, curbing rapid capacity loss in EV batteries
summary: Researchers have identified that lattice structural distortion causes capacity fading in high-nickel cathodes used in electric vehicle batteries. By substituting a small amount of nickel with aluminum, they successfully stabilized the cathode structure, significantly enhancing battery lifespan and safety, which could impact next-generation high-performance battery design.

title: ZincFive Raises $30M for AI Data Center Batteries
summary: ZincFive secured $30 million to advance its patented nickel-zinc battery technology, which offers superior power density, safety, and sustainability compared to lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries. The technology is gaining traction for AI data center infrastructure due to its compact size, low maintenance, and environmental benefits.

title: Next-Gen Battery Chemistries Shift to Silicon and Nickel
summary: A new report highlights the growing adoption of silicon-enhanced anodes and high-nickel cathodes in battery technology, especially for electric vehicles requiring high energy density. These innovations aim to reduce cobalt reliance and improve battery capacity, though challenges remain in thermal management and manufacturing complexity.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: The Nickel Institute discusses innovations in nickel production including NOVONIX’s patented zero-waste cathode synthesis technology, which reduces costs and environmental impact. The article also emphasizes nickel's sustainability potential across its lifecycle and its critical role in energy transition technologies such as green hydrogen and electric vehicle batteries.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity comes from renewable sources and 93% of its employees have permanent contracts. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company's commitment to innovation and environmental responsibility in the stainless steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne initiates another three-month temporary layoffs round
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has notified trade unions about implementing a second temporary layoff scheme this year, reflecting ongoing operational adjustments in the stainless steel longs production sector. Details beyond the notification require subscription access.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Fifth exit in 2023: Mutares has signed an agreement to sell Special Melted Products to Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Mutares SE & Co. KGaA signed an agreement to sell Special Melted Products Ltd. to Cogne Acciai Speciali for approximately EUR 180 million, expected to close in Q2 2023. This acquisition aims to strengthen Cogne Acciai Speciali's market position in stainless steel long products and nickel alloys.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italian Manufacturer Cogne Acciai Speciali to Acquire German Tube Producer Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is planning to acquire the entire German tube producer Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH, expanding its footprint in the European stainless steel market. The acquisition is subject to approval by the European Commission.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris S A : Buy-back transactions - Weekly Report (December 1, 2025 – December 5, 2025)
summary: Tenaris reported buy-back transactions as part of the second tranche of its share buyback program. The company purchased shares on multiple trading venues with the intention to cancel treasury shares acquired under the program.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
date: Not explicitly dated but recent to December 2025
summary: Tenaris maintained profitability in 2025 with steady sales in the North American oil and gas tube market. Despite some tariff increases and reduced drilling in certain regions, the company’s margins held up well and sales remained resilient.

title: Tenaris Completes First Tranche of USD600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first USD600 million tranche of its USD1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing over 33 million ordinary shares representing 3.08% of its total issued share capital. The company plans to cancel the treasury shares to enhance shareholder value.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales, driven by stable drilling activity in the US and Canada. This performance was unexpected and highlights resilience in key markets.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The project aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security and supporting the shift toward cleaner energy. The submarine cable will run between Sicily and Tunisia, with installation operations carried out by the Prysmian Monna Lisa vessel.

title: Prysmian SpA Outlook Revised To Negative On High Leverage
summary: S&P Global revised Prysmian SpA's outlook to negative due to high leverage concerns. The Italy-based cable manufacturer recently entered into a definitive agreement to acquire U.S.-based cable manufacturer Encore, which impacts its financial profile.
